oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Radisson Plaza Hotel groundbreaking with Mayor Fulton, Nashville, Tennessee, 1978 February
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The official groundbreaking ceremony for a new Radisson Plaza Hotel in downtown Nashville with Mayor Richard Fulton, circa February 1978. This was a phase of the Commerce Place, a whole-block development in the central business district. The hotel is named after the 17th-century French explorer Pierre-Espirit Radisson. An historical re-enactor and a music ensemble are featured in the ceremony program. Forms part of the Metro Archives Photographs - Buildings Collection. 13 b & w photographs.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Radisson Plaza Hotel groundbreaking with Mayor Fulton, Nashville, Tennessee, 1978 February
